group.title: Item Exhibition
group.description:
Exciting attacks using a variety of items - Enjoy the fun of defense and the fun of dynamic racing at the same time.
In the item battle, where rankings change with a single attack, the moment you cross the finish line is one moment at a time. It will also make you unstoppable.

group2.title: Escape quickly
group2.description:
If you get hit by a water bomb or water fly, press the left and right arrow keys quickly!
You can escape quickly, and after escaping, press the front key again to activate an instant booster.
group2.caption: Example image of quick escape before in-game items

group3.title: Winning method
group3.description:
In an item match, if you or your teammate finishes in first place, that team wins.
(Same for duos and squads)

group6.title: Terms related to the item war

itemList.name: Booster
itemList.itemDesc: Enables you to temporarily sprint at high speed when used.
itemList.tip: It usually appears in the lower ranks.

itemList.name: Banana
itemList.itemDesc:
If you step on a banana, it will slide and spin.
(My team can step on it too.)
itemList.tip: Only appears in 1st place in solo matches and 3rd place in team matches.

itemList.name: magnet
itemList.itemDesc:
Using the power of a strong magnetic field, you can
approach your target racer at high speed.
itemList.tip: It usually appears in the lower ranks.

itemList.name: missile
itemList.itemDesc:
Aim! Fire! Aim the racer ahead of you so you can
blow it away.
(My team is unaffected)
itemList.tip: Mainly appears in the middle ranks.

itemList.name: barricade
itemList.itemDesc:
A barricade appears in front of the No. 1 racer!
Immediately blocks the route of the No. 1 racer and hinders driving.
(Your team can also get in the way in a team battle.)
itemList.tip: Mostly from the middle to the bottom ranks.

itemList.name: spaceship
itemList.itemDesc:
A spaceship descends and picks up the
racer who is running in first place, disrupting the run.
(My team is unaffected)
itemList.tip: Mostly from mid to low ranks.

itemList.name: water bomb
itemList.itemDesc:
Throws water bombs forward! Can trap racers a certain distance in front of them

(Your team can get stuck too in team fights)

itemList.name: water fly
itemList.itemDesc:
Wheein~ I can get a racer running right ahead of me
get stuck in a drop.
(My team is unaffected)
itemList.tip: Mostly from mid to low ranks.

itemList.name: Thunderbolt
itemList.itemDesc:
Jijijik, thunderbolts down all racers ahead of me
interferes with their driving.
(Only affects the opposing team, it's best to use it at the bottom.)
itemList.tip: Mainly appears in the middle ranks.

itemList.name: electromagnetic waves
itemList.itemDesc:
Block the spaceship's attack with electromagnetic waves! You can cut off the
communication of the spaceship and quickly escape from the obstacle
. .)
itemList.tip: He usually appears in the upper ranks, and in teamfights he appears in the middle ranks.

itemList.name: shield
itemList.itemDesc:
Attacks are nullified for a certain period of time! Blocks an opponent's specific attack once
.

itemList.name: angel
itemList.itemDesc:
Under the protection of an angel, our team racer
cannot be attacked by any attack for a certain period of time.
(This is an item that only appears in team battles.)

itemTips.title: 1. Use angels right away
itemTips.desc:
Unless you're on the phone with your teammates for a status briefing, it's best to use angels as soon as you get them.
Since you don't know each other's status.

itemTips.title: 2. Let's have electromagnetic waves just in case
itemTips.desc:
If your teammate is in first place, it's good to have someone on your team with microwaves.
Because you never know when the other side will launch the ship.

itemTips.title: 3. Must have boosters or magnets on easy maps
itemTips.desc:
On maps with a long last straight line, such as Village Canal, Desert Veggie Market, and Ice Halfpipe,
opponents often reverse with boosters or magnets at the end.
So it's really urgent. If not, it's good to keep boosters and magnets until the end of the game.

itemTips.title: 4. Be careful with water bombs, bananas, and barricades that can team kill
itemTips.desc:
Items like water bombs, bananas, and barricades affect our teammates, so we have to use them while monitoring the situation.
Alternatively, using angels first and then water bombs can be a good idea.

itemTerm.detail:
Scratch, Scratch, Scrape: An act of sweeping all item boxes in a line by one person, a kind of bad manners that prevents other users from acquiring items
.

Tight Water: The track before the normal item is wider than the water bomb range, so if you drive on both ends (sides), you can avoid water bomb attacks.
But if the road is not wide, the water bomb There are cases where it falls within the range, and it is a word that refers to this.
Sangcheon: Means the opponent used an angel.
Sangcheon: Means the opponent used an angel.
Aloft: A call to indicate when a missile hit will lift you into the air.
Sangcheon: Means the opponent used an angel.

End: The act of shooting a missile at the end of the game when 1st place finished.
In the original Kartrider 1, it was a bad manners.
Eakcheon: To use immediately upon obtaining an angel.

Water: A water bomb or water fly item, a notification that you have been hit by a water bomb or water fly.
However, in the case of a water fly, it is said to be a fly, so it is more commonly used to refer to water bombs.
Teamwater: A term used to refer to a teammate's water bomb.

Distance: The distance at which the water bomb is thrown. Usually, it depends on the sense, but among the dead people, memorize the distance by track and position
and throw the water bomb. Or, when there is a large difference in distance, It can also be expressed as a few differences.

Buzzed: A case in which a missile or magnet item is being aimed, but fails to aim and the item is blown away.
It is expressed as “the missile is beeping”, “the magnet is beeping”, etc.
Mischief or Mijik: only aiming missiles or magnetic items.
Barri: A barricade item.
Bar: Banana items.
Burn: Thunderbolt item. The official name is Thunderbolt, but it is called Lightning for convenience.
Wall Beauty: Shooting a missile through a wall. When the aiming point turns red, it fires at the enemy through walls or obstacles.
Sucking: If you hit a magnet item, or if your opponent uses a magnet item.

Sensil: Abbreviation for center shield, the act of anticipating an opponent's attack and using the shield in advance. It is mainly used in narrow tight sections,
before shortcuts, jump sections, and before the finish line.
Cloth: An angel item. Also used to ask team members to use an angel item when briefing.
Egg (R): Called R for convenience because the default rearrangement is R. Used to drag opponents back when they suck a magnet in front of the finish line.

Ilmi: Short for first class missile, meaning that the missile was fired at the first class. Ilpa (first class water fly) has the same meaning.
(In the original work, the first class missile item is sometimes shortened. )
Inpa: Since bananas are laid on the in-course, it means to dig the line outside so that you don't step on it.
Jjabu: Combining magnets and boosters.
Calmul: A water bomb that falls right over your head. A must-have technique when using a water bomb because it's hard to react.
Termination: The official name is electromagnetic waves, but for convenience it is called space termination or termination.
